page.title: 17SWANSCOMBE CHURCH
page.content: Swanscombe Church is of the Church of England and is about 935 years old. It was built about 1050, with various sections being added at later dates. It has flint walls. The church is named St. Peter & St. Paul. There are 19 people on the Parochial Council. 12 woman and 7 men, including the Reverend Mercer, who became rector in January 1985. In the Church Centre, near the church, the weekly meetings are :Ladies Circle ,Church Fellowship, Play group, Dance class, Mother & Toddlers group, Band practice. The Church services include:Sunday Service(Holy Communion & Evensong), Monthly Pram services, Weddings, Funerals & Baptisms. Also in the church are some very picturesque stained glass windows, and historically interesting tombs.
